panels.title: VOLUME BLOCK UTILIZATION
panels.description: Percentage of nonzero blocks (This is the closest measurement we have to 'volume fullness')

panels.title: VOLUME THROUGHPUT UTILIZATION
panels.description: How much of the volume's throughput capacity (IOPS) is being utilized

panels.title: ISCSI SESSIONS
panels.description: Number of ISCSI sessions to the volume

panels.title: OVERALL READ %
panels.description: The total read operations percentage to the volume since the creation of the volume.

panels.title: OVERALL WRITE %
panels.description: The total write operations percentage to the volume since the creation of the volume.

panels.title: VOLUME CAPACITY
panels.description: Volume nonzero blocks / (nonzero blocks + zero blocks)

panels.title: ISCSI SESSIONS
panels.description: Number of ISCSI sessions to the volume

panels.title: VOLUME UTILIZATION
panels.description: Percentage of allotted IOPS consumed by volume. Note: it's possible to burst to above 100% by making use of burst credits the volume has accumulated.

panels.title: VOLUME ACTUAL IOPS
panels.description: The current actual IOPS for the volume in the last 500 milliseconds

panels.title: VOLUME IOP SIZE
panels.description: The average size in bytes of recent I/O to the volume in the last 500 milliseconds.

panels.title: VOLUME CLIENT QUEUE DEPTH
panels.description: The number of outstanding read and write operations to the volume.

panels.title: VOLUME THROTTLE
panels.description: Represents how much the system is throttling clients below their maxIOPS because of replication of data, transient errors, and snapshots taken.
